Welcome to iCLIPHMMProject’s documentation!¶

Contents:

class core.hiddenmarkovmodel.HiddenMarkovModel(emission_alphabet, state_alphabet, state_type)[source]¶

Class that represent hidden Markov model.

Parameters:
  • emission_alphabet – List of strings that represent emission symbols.
  • state_alphabet – List of strings that represent state symbols.
  • state_type – Single string that represents the type of states.
Specification of an HMM:

  1. N, the number if states in the model. We denote the set of all possible states as S = {S_{1}, S_{2}, ... , S_{N}}, the state at time t as q_{t}.

  2. M, the number of distinct observation symbols per state, i.e., the discrete alphabet size of the output set, We denote the set of all possible output symbols as V = {v_{1}, v_{2}, ... , v_{m}},

    the output symbol at the time t is O_{t}. The sequence of observed symbols is denoted as O = O_{1} * O_{2} * ... * O_{T}.

  3. The state transition probability distribution A = {a_{ij}}, where a_{ij} = P[q_{t+1} = S_{j} | q_{t} = S_{i}], 1 <= i, j <= N.

  4. The observation symbol probability distribution in state j, B = {b_{j}(k)}, where b_{j}(k) = P[O_{t} = v_{k} | q_{t} = S_{j}], 1 <= j <= N, 1 <= k <= M.

  5. The initial state distributions Pi = {Pi_{i}}, where Pi_{i} = P[q_{1} = S_{i}], 1 <= i <= N.

backward_probability(emission_matrix, transition_matrix, emission_sequence)[source]¶

Method that calculates the backward matrix and backward probability for give sequence of emissions.

Parameters:
  • emission_matrix – Represents the current emission matrix of our HMM.
  • transition_matrix – Represents the current transition matrix of our HMM.
  • emission_sequence – String that represents the given emission sequence.
Returns:

Backward matrix and backward probability.
  1. Initialization:

    Beta_{T}(i) = 1, 1 <= i <= N.

  2. Induction:

    Beta_{t}(i) = SUM_{j=1}^{N} a_{ij} * b_{j}(O_{t+1} * Beta_{t+1}(j)), 1 <= t <= T - 1, 1 <= j <= N.

backward_probability_constant(emission_matrix, transition_matrix, emission_sequence, constant)[source]¶

Method that calculates the backward matrix and backward probability for give sequence of emissions.

Parameters:
  • emission_matrix – Represents the current emission matrix of our HMM.
  • transition_matrix – Represents the current transition matrix of our HMM.
  • emission_sequence – String that represents the given emission sequence.
  • constant – Value with which we multiply values at each step to prevent underflow.
Returns:

Backward matrix and backward probability.
  1. Initialization:

    Beta_{T}(i) = 1, 1 <= i <= N.

  2. Induction:

    Beta_{t}(i) = SUM_{j=1}^{N} a_{ij} * b_{j}(O_{t+1} * Beta_{t+1}(j)), 1 <= t <= T - 1, 1 <= j <= N.

backward_probability_log(emission_matrix, transition_matrix, emission_sequence)[source]¶

Method that calculates the backward matrix and backward probability for give sequence of emissions.

Parameters:
  • emission_matrix – Represents the current emission matrix of our HMM.
  • transition_matrix – Represents the current transition matrix of our HMM.
  • emission_sequence – String that represents the given emission sequence.
Returns:

Backward matrix and backward probability.
  1. Initialization:

    Beta_{T}(i) = 1, 1 <= i <= N.

  2. Induction:

    Beta_{t}(i) = SUM_{j=1}^{N} a_{ij} * b_{j}(O_{t+1} * Beta_{t+1}(j)), 1 <= t <= T - 1, 1 <= j <= N.

backward_probability_normalized(emission_matrix, transition_matrix, emission_sequence)[source]¶

Method that calculates the backward matrix and backward probability for give sequence of emissions.

Parameters:
  • emission_matrix – Represents the current emission matrix of our HMM.
  • transition_matrix – Represents the current transition matrix of our HMM.
  • emission_sequence – String that represents the given emission sequence.
Returns:

Backward matrix and backward probability.
  1. Initialization:

    Beta_{T}(i) = 1, 1 <= i <= N.

  2. Induction:

    Beta_{t}(i) = SUM_{j=1}^{N} a_{ij} * b_{j}(O_{t+1} * Beta_{t+1}(j)), 1 <= t <= T - 1, 1 <= j <= N.

backward_probability_scaled(emission_matrix, transition_matrix, emission_sequence, scale_matrix)[source]¶

Method that calculates the backward matrix and backward probability for give sequence of emissions.

Parameters:
  • emission_matrix – Represents the current emission matrix of our HMM.
  • transition_matrix – Represents the current transition matrix of our HMM.
  • emission_sequence – String that represents the given emission sequence.
  • scale_matrix – Matrix of scales from forward algorithm.
Returns:

Backward matrix and backward probability.
  1. Initialization:

    Beta_{T}(i) = 1, 1 <= i <= N.

  2. Induction:

    Beta_{t}(i) = SUM_{j=1}^{N} a_{ij} * b_{j}(O_{t+1} * Beta_{t+1}(j)), 1 <= t <= T - 1, 1 <= j <= N.

Scaling:
  1. Initialization:

    Beta_{T}^{**}(i) = 1 Beta_{T}^{^}(i) = c_{T} * Beta_{T}^{**}(i)

  2. Induction:

    Beta_{t}^{**}(i) = SUM_{j=1}^{N} a_{ij} * b_{j}(O_{t+1} * Beta_{t+1}^{^}(j)) Beta_{t}^{^}(i) = c_{t} * Beta_{t}^{**}(i)

baum_welch_training(sequences)[source]¶

Method that trains current hidden Markov model with given sequences emissions using Baum-Welch algorithm

Parameters:sequences – List of string of emissions.
create_state_matrix(sequence)[source]¶

Method that reorganizes state sequence in state matrix where each row represents each state and 1 in each column represents which state is active at current location in sequence.

Parameters:sequence – Current sequence.
Returns:Matrix that represents state sequence.
static eexp(x)[source]¶

The extended exponential function is the standard exponential function e^{x}, except that it is extended to handle log zero, and is defined as follows:

  1. for a real number x: eexp(x) = e^{x}
  2. for x = LOGZERO: eexp(x) = 0
Parameters:x – Input value.
Returns:Exponential value of input value.
static eln(x)[source]¶

The extended logarithm is the standard logarithm provided, except that it is extended to handle inputs of zero, and is defined as follows:

  1. for positive real numbers x: eln(x) = ln(x)
  2. for x = 0: eln(x) = LOGZERO
Parameters:x – Input value.
Returns:Logarithmic value of input value.
static elndivision(x, y)[source]¶

The extended logarithm product function returns the logarithm of the division of x and y, and is defined as follows:

  1. for positive real y and y: elndivision(eln(x), eln(y)) = eln(x) - eln(y)
  2. for x = 0: elndivision(LOGZERO, eln(y)) = LOGZERO
  3. for y = 0: elndivision(eln(x), LOGZERO) = LOGZERO
Parameters:
  • x – First logarithmic input value.
  • y – Second logarithmic input value.
Returns:

The logarithmic product of input values.
static elnproduct(x, y)[source]¶

The extended logarithm product function returns the logarithm of the product of x and y, and is defined as follows:

  1. for positive real y and y: elnproduct(eln(x), eln(y)) = eln(x) + eln(y)
  2. for x = 0: elnproduct(LOGZERO, eln(y)) = LOGZERO
  3. for y = 0: elnproduct(eln(x), LOGZERO) = LOGZERO
Parameters:
  • x – First logarithmic input value.
  • y – Second logarithmic input value.
Returns:

The logarithmic product of input values.
elnsum(x, y)[source]¶

The extended logarithm sum function computes the extended logarithm of the sum of x and y given as inputs the extended logarithm of x an y, and is defines as follows:

  1. for positive real x and y: elnsum(eln(x), eln(y)) = eln(x + y)
  2. for x = 0: elnsum(LOGZERO, eln(y)) = eln(y)
  3. for y = 0: elnsum(eln(x), LOGZERO) = eln(x)
Parameters:
  • x – First logarithmic input value.
  • y – Second logarithmic input value.
Returns:

The logarithmic sum of input values.
forward_probability(emission_matrix, transition_matrix, emission_sequence)[source]¶

Method that calculates the forward matrix and forward probability for give sequence of emissions.

Parameters:
  • emission_matrix – Represents the current emission matrix of our HMM.
  • transition_matrix – Represents the current transition matrix of our HMM.
  • emission_sequence – String that represents the given emission sequence.
Returns:

Forward matrix and forward probability.
  1. Initialization:

    Alpha_{t}(i) = Pi_{i} * b_{i}(O_{1}), 1 <= i <= N.

  2. Induction:

    Alpha_{t+1}(j) = [SUM_{i=1}^{N} Alpha_{t}(i) * a_{ij}] * b_{j}(O_{t+1}), 1 <= t <= T - 1, 1 <= j <= N.

forward_probability_constant(emission_matrix, transition_matrix, emission_sequence, constant)[source]¶

Method that calculates the forward matrix and forward probability for give sequence of emissions.

Parameters:
  • emission_matrix – Represents the current emission matrix of our HMM.
  • transition_matrix – Represents the current transition matrix of our HMM.
  • emission_sequence – String that represents the given emission sequence.
  • constant – Value with which we multiply values at each step to prevent underflow.
Returns:

Forward matrix and forward probability.
  1. Initialization:

    Alpha_{t}(i) = Pi_{i} * b_{i}(O_{1}), 1 <= i <= N.

  2. Induction:

    Alpha_{t+1}(j) = [SUM_{i=1}^{N} Alpha_{t}(i) * a_{ij}] * b_{j}(O_{t+1}), 1 <= t <= T - 1, 1 <= j <= N.

forward_probability_log(emission_matrix, transition_matrix, emission_sequence)[source]¶

Method that calculates the forward matrix and forward probability for give sequence of emissions.

Parameters:
  • emission_matrix – Represents the current emission matrix of our HMM.
  • transition_matrix – Represents the current transition matrix of our HMM.
  • emission_sequence – String that represents the given emission sequence.
Returns:

Forward matrix and forward probability.
  1. Initialization:

    Alpha_{t}(i) = Pi_{i} * b_{i}(O_{1}), 1 <= i <= N.

  2. Induction:

    Alpha_{t+1}(j) = [SUM_{i=1}^{N} Alpha_{t}(i) * a_{ij}] * b_{j}(O_{t+1}), 1 <= t <= T - 1, 1 <= j <= N.

forward_probability_normalized(emission_matrix, transition_matrix, emission_sequence)[source]¶

Method that calculates the forward matrix and forward probability for give sequence of emissions.

Parameters:
  • emission_matrix – Represents the current emission matrix of our HMM.
  • transition_matrix – Represents the current transition matrix of our HMM.
  • emission_sequence – String that represents the given emission sequence.
Returns:

Forward matrix and forward probability.
  1. Initialization:

    Alpha_{t}(i) = Pi_{i} * b_{i}(O_{1}), 1 <= i <= N.

  2. Induction:

    Alpha_{t+1}(j) = [SUM_{i=1}^{N} Alpha_{t}(i) * a_{ij}] * b_{j}(O_{t+1}), 1 <= t <= T - 1, 1 <= j <= N.

forward_probability_scaled(emission_matrix, transition_matrix, emission_sequence)[source]¶

Method that calculates the scaled forward matrix and scaled forward probability for give sequence of emissions.

Parameters:
  • emission_matrix – Represents the current emission matrix of our HMM.
  • transition_matrix – Represents the current transition matrix of our HMM.
  • emission_sequence – String that represents the given emission sequence.
Returns:

Forward matrix, scale matrix and forward probability.
  1. Initialization:

    Alpha_{1}(i) = Pi_{i} * b_{i}(O_{1}), 1 <= i <= N.

  2. Induction:

    Alpha_{t+1}(j) = [SUM_{i=1}^{N} Alpha_{t}(i) * a_{ij}] * b_{j}(O_{t+1}), 1 <= t <= T - 1, 1 <= j <= N.

Scaling:
  1. Initialization:

    Alpha_{1}^{**}(i) = Alpha_{1}(i) c_{1} = 1 / [SUM_{i=1}^{N} Alpha_{1}^{**}(i)] Alpha_{1}^{^}(i) = c_{1} * Alpha_{1}^{**}(i)

  2. Induction:

    Alpha_{1}^{**}(i) = [SUM_{j=1}^{N} Alpha_{t-1}^{^}(j) * a_{ji}] * b_{i}(O_{t}) c_{t} = 1 / [SUM_{i=1}^{N} Alpha_{t}^{**}(i)] Alpha_{t}^{^}(i) = c_{t} * Alpha_{t}^{**}(i)

state_sequence_training(sequences)[source]¶

Method that trains current hidden Markov model with given sequences of states and emissions, for combining probabilities we use weighted sum, where weights are represented by sequence lengths.

Parameters:sequences – List of string of states and string of emissions.
Returns:Array of transition and emission matrices for each sequence and all other sequence data.

read_dna_string_from_to(start_location, stop_location, string_direction)[source]¶

Method that returns the chosen substring of the whole nucleotide string.

  • A - Adenine
  • C - Cytosine
  • G - Guanine
  • T - Thymine
  • N - Any of the nucleotides.
Parameters:
  • start_location – Index that represents the start of substring.
  • stop_location – Index that represents the end of substring.
  • string_direction – String (‘+’ or ‘-‘) that sets the direction in which the nucleotides are read.
Returns:

The chosen substring of the whole nucleotide string.

calculate_the_percentage_of_variance_measure(matrices, k_range, output_file)[source]¶

Method that calculates percentage of variance measure for different number of cluster for k-means clustering on given data and draws them on a graph.

Parameters:
  • matrices – Given transition and emission matrices.
  • k_range – Given range of number of cluster to evaluate.
  • output_file – Given string for naming the output file.

  • emissions_alphabet_test – List of emissions in test data.
  • extracted_variables – Variables extracted for sequence and HMM building.
  • final_generated_test_sequences – List of test sequences to correct.
Returns:

List of corrected test sequences.

static cross_validation_of_hmm(train_sequences, test_sequences, states_alphabet, emissions_alphabet, hmm_type, file_name, dump)[source]¶

Method that builds HMM from train sequences and cross validates it on test sequences.

Parameters:
  • train_sequences – List of train sequences.
  • test_sequences – List of test sequences.
  • states_alphabet – List of state names for HMM.
  • emissions_alphabet – List of emissions names for HMM.
  • hmm_type – String that determines the type of HMM.
  • file_name – Name of the output files.
  • dump – Logical switch for writing results to file.
Returns:

List of ROC values for visualization and singe AUC value for each state.
cross_validation_of_hmm_with_extraction(sequences, percent_of_train_sequences, percent_of_inner_train_sequences, number_of_repetitions, number_of_inner_repetitions, hmm_type, kmer_size, best_kmers, state_neighbourhoods, annotations_size, roc_ratio, kmer_probability_ratio, annotation_probability_ratio, minimal_distance_between_kmer_ratio, minimal_distance_between_annotation_ratio, dump, file_name)[source]¶

Method that finds the most expressive variables from sequences and build the final HMM.

Parameters:
  • sequences – List of all sequences.
  • percent_of_train_sequences – Percent of train data at first division of sequences.
  • percent_of_inner_train_sequences – Percent of train data at second division of sequences.
  • number_of_repetitions – Number of repetitions of the whole process.
  • number_of_inner_repetitions – Number of repetitions of findind the best variables.
  • hmm_type – String that determines the type of HMM.
  • kmer_size – Number that denotes the size of kmers.
  • best_kmers – List of numbers which denotes how many best kmers are used in building HMM.
  • state_neighbourhoods – Dictionary which represents the size of neighbourhood for each state.
  • annotations_size – Number that denotes the size of annotations.
  • roc_ratio – Number that denotes minimal AUC of ROC for variable for use in final HMM building.
  • kmer_probability_ratio – Number that denotes minimal ratio of kmer for use in HMM building.
  • annotation_probability_ratio – Number that denotes minimal ratio of annotation for use in HMM building.
  • minimal_distance_between_kmer_ratio – Number that denotes minimal ratio difference for the same kmer between different states for use in HMM building.
  • minimal_distance_between_annotation_ratio – Number that denotes minimal ratio difference for the same annotation between different states for use in HMM building.
  • file_name – Name of the output files.
  • dump – Logical switch for writing results to file.

  • file_name – Name of the output file.

  • y_score – Matrix of probabilities.
  • file_manager – Given file manager object.
  • experiment – Given ID of single experiment.
  • state_index – Given ID of wanted state inside the matrix of probabilities.
Returns:

List of points(probability of crosslink, iclip intensity).
sequences_statistics(sequences, kmer_size, state_neighbourhoods, annotations_size, file_name, dump)[source]¶

Method that calculates the probabilities of nucleotides, kmers and annotations for each specific state and its neighbourhood.

Parameters:
  • sequences – Given list of sequences.
  • kmer_size – Given size of kmers.
  • state_neighbourhoods – Dictionary that represent the neighbourhood size for each specific state.
  • annotations_size – Number of annotations in emissions.
  • file_name – Given file name for saving the statistics to disk.
  • dump – Logical switch for writing results to file.
Returns:

List of probabilities of nucleotides annotations and kmers for given states and neighbourhoods for given list of sequences.
